snippet: Chinese officials said the son of Ling Jihua, a close ally of the departing president, died in a crash in which two women in the Ferrari he was driving were seriously injured and all were in various states of undress.
abstract: Chinese officials say that the son of Ling Jihua, a close ally of the departing president Hu Jintao, died in a car crash in which two women in the Ferrari he was driving were seriously injured and all were in various states of undress; Ling suffers sudden demotion after scandal is revealed; analysts question how this shift, which comes in the midst of China's once-in-a-decade power transition, will affect Hu.

byline.contributor: Andrew Jacobs and Jonathan Ansfield contributed reporting, and Mia Li contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Chinese officials said the son of Ling Jihua, a close ally of the departing president, died in a crash in which two women in the Ferrari he was driving were seriously injured and all were in various states of undress.

headline.seo: After Ling Jihua’s Demotion, News of Son’s Crash in Ferrari
headline.main: China Faces New Scandal Over Crash of a Ferrari
headline.print_headline: China Faces New Scandal Over Crash Of a Ferrari
